subject: Climate & Environment
title: From Farm Loss to Fork Waste
description: A 60-second lesson on From Farm Loss to Fork Waste.

hook.text: In sub-Saharan Africa, 40% of food is lost after harvest â€” before it ever reaches a market.

buildup.text: Poor roads, no refrigeration, and few storage facilities mean crops rot in the field.

discovery.text: Simple solutions like solar dryers and metal grain silos can cut post-harvest loss by half.

twist.text: In wealthy countries, the waste shifts to the consumer. Americans throw out 40% of their food.

climax.text: The problem is different at each stage but the effect is the same: resources wasted, people hungry.

punchline.text: Hunger and waste exist side by side. That's the real scandal.
